elevation_page module

class elevation_page.ElevationPage(main, name)[source]

Bases: TabPage

Widget for editing Digital Elevation Model (DEM) settings in the application.

This tab allows users to define and configure DEM layers, set files for each layer, and specify GDAL settings to merge DEM files. The tab also supports drag-and-drop for adding elevation files and provides buttons for DEM download sites.

main

Reference to the main application instance.

Type:

MainClass

settings_widget

Widget for displaying and editing DEM settings based on

Type:

SettingsWidget

the configuration.
drop_widget

Widget for handling file drops for files with .tif extensions.

Type:

FileDropWidget

Type:

Methods:

create_download_buttons(button_list)[source]

Creates download buttons and connects each button to open its respective URL.

Parameters:

button_list (list of tuple) – List of tuples where each tuple contains: - label (str): The button label. - config_key (str): The configuration key to retrieve the URL.

Returns:

A layout containing all the created download buttons.

Return type:

QLayout

load(project)[source]

Load settings for the selected project and update the display.

Parameters:

project (Project) – The project instance to load settings from.

Returns:

True if settings were loaded and displayed successfully.

Return type:

bool

on_tab_enter()[source]

Refreshes and validates settings when the tab is entered

open_url(config_key)[source]

Opens the URL associated with the given configuration key in the default web browser.

Parameters:

config_key (str) – Key in the application configuration that maps to a URL.

Raises:

Warning – Displays a warning message if the URL is empty, invalid, or cannot be opened.

update_files_list(source_file)[source]

Adds a new DEM file to the list of elevation files maintaining unique entries.

Parameters:

source_file (str) – The file path of the file to add.

validate()[source]

todo: Validate the elevation files specified exist Not implemented. Validates the elevation files specified in the configuration to ensure they exist.

If any files are missing, updates the status label to notify the user.
